title: Research scientist in statistical genetics
field: Animal Biology & Ethology, Applied Mathematics, Genetics, Statistics,
job_description: Natural Resources Institute Finland (Luke) is a research organisation working to promote bioeconomy and sustainable use of natural resources. We provide solutions and services to our customers based on best available scientific knowledge. Our research results and services generate added value and sustainability as well as scientific evidence to support decision making. We carry out research on forestry, agriculture, food, game, and fisheries. We also perform statutory services.Being open-minded and curious and having a strong will to leave a positive mark to the world binds Luke people together. Together we build a positive working culture where each otherâs work is highly respected. In Luke, the work assignments are versatile and employees can influence on the content of their work within the scope of project objectives. We work in a mobile work culture which gives you the possibility to work from where ever it is feasible for your tasks. Luke offers a multidisciplinary international research environment with unique research infrastructures, experimental sites and well-equipped laboratories.Work tasksNatural Resources Institute Finland (Luke) is recruiting an early career research scientist to join our genomics and breeding research group which is one of the world leaders in developing computational solutions for large genetic evaluations. The person will work with genomic evaluation projects in animal genetics. The main focus is development of genomic breeding value prediction models for dairy cattle with linear and non-linear models. Additionally, publication of research results in peer reviewed journals and participation in grant applications will be important. The person is expected to work as a team member together with other researchers in computational genetics and to cooperate closely with animal breeding industry nationally and internationally.This position is an excellent opportunity to develop into a recognized specialist in the field of breeding value prediction.A personnel security clearance may be obtained for a person chosen for an office or a post with his or her consent (Security Clearance Act 726/2014). For more information on the security clearance procedure and the rights of the person subject to clearance, visit www.supo.fi QualificationsThe successful applicant must have a doctoral degree or be in the finishing stage of a PhD program, in animal breeding, quantitative genetics, statistics, applied mathematics, or a similar field. Proven experience in applying genetic and/or genomic methods for breeding value prediction of large data are required. Good skills in quantitative genetics and statistical modelling are desired. Good knowledge on mathematical statistics and experience with programming (in Fortran, C or similar) are an advantage.The selected person is required to have a proven track record of scientific publications in international peer-reviewed journals. Successful acquisition of competitive research funding is considered as an advantage. The successful applicant should possess good co-operational and communication skills.
